creator: urkle@outoforder.cc
text:
The functions and structures in mod_ssl's public API (mod_ssl.h) are not
exported correctly using AP_DECLARE and AP_DECALRE_NONSTD for use on win32
systems. I was trying to compile mod_log_sql with mod_ssl support under windows
2k and ran into this *road block*. Namely I am accessing the ssl_module struct
(via the myConnConfig macro) and ssl_var_lookup function in the SSL functionity
of my module.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
ssl_var_lookup is an optional function, so the correct way to use it is via the
optional function interfaces.   Nothing else is supposed to be part of the
public API, so if you can't get it via ssl_var_lookup, you can't get it at all.

mod_headers on HEAD has an example of using ssl_var_lookup correctly:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/httpd-2.0/modules/metadata/mod_headers.c?annotate=1.1.1.1
